meanings.definition: A person who executes a will jointly with another person.
meanings.sent1: My sister and I were named coexecutors in our grandmother's will.
meanings.sent2: The coexecutor and I worked together to carry out the wishes of the deceased.
meanings.sent3: As coexecutors, we had to make sure the will was followed to the letter.
meanings.sent4: Being a coexecutor felt like being a team captain in charge of a special mission.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of a coexecutor is to ensure the will is executed correctly.

meanings.definition: One of two or more executors who administer an estate jointly.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer explained that I would be a coexecutor alongside my cousin.
meanings.sent2: The coexecutor and I had to work together to manage the estate efficiently.
meanings.sent3: Becoming a coexecutor felt like being part of a legal partnership.
meanings.sent4: The role of a coexecutor is to share the responsibilities of estate administration.
meanings.sent5: In the end, being a coexecutor was a rewarding experience.
